I have an additional suggestion.  Perhaps each of those among us who collect and study tsuba might take the time to write a few paragraphs identifying the particular merits of, and reasons for collecting, a particular school.  The really outspoken might go farther and identify a school, or type, of tsuba they do not collect, and explain why.

DZ     
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: klepet33319 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, March 12, 2006 3:42 PM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Kantei


  I for one have enjoyed Jim's kantei(s).  I am wondering if the other 
  members concur and if they might like something like a regular kantei, 
  possibly Friday with answer on Sunday?  Or bi-weekly? Perhaps we could 
  generate a list of those interested in submitting their treasures with 
  one member being chosen by Jim each week.  Then that party could post a 
  picture with Jim giving his ideas at the close of the bidding.  That 
  way he'd be on the hot-seat as well (although I think luke warm in his 
  case at best LOL).  Just some thoughts.
